Comments_List: Basic mechanisms and therapy for both common diseases and rare diseases. Know more about the research faculty are working on.
A general understanding behind the mechanisms that cause various diseases.
It was very out of my comfort zone and was interesting to learn about a broad range of topics. Thought to think outside of immunology and more clinically

Strengths; module system, good overview
Weaknesses; confusion regarding assessment & exams

The strength is that there are several modules in this course. Students should have several modules that interest them. The weakness is that there are still some categories of diseases such as metabolism not fully covered in this course.

More coherent final section.
Option for different paper topics

The course was fairly disorganized. It would be better if the class more strictly adhered to the syllabus regarding examinations. I think it would also be useful to create a syllabus that listed all the planned lecture topics on the day in which the lecture will be given, so students can come mentally prepared. It would be useful to make the modules more concrete and outlined before the lectures in said module are given (such as was done with the hematology module) because it oriented the lecture within the module. I would suggest to lecturers to focus less on their personal research. I would have lecturers submit their questions to the exam rather than having it written by a third party, unlike what was done with the hematology lecture. I would suggest, if possible, that lecturers are informed of the prior lecture content, in order to prevent repetitive information. I think it would be better for students to have more choice in the subject of their final paper--maybe not complete autonomy, but perhaps several options instead of just the one. Overall, I think that the topics addressed in the class were very diverse and interesting, I just think that the class could be further enhanced with a greater sense of organization.

The organization seemed a little underdeveloped and there were parts of the course that I thought would occur and then didn't or vv. The content was very interesting, but wasn't always consolidated well and lecturerers didn't always seem to know what exactly they should be teaching us. It has a lot of potential though, and I did enjoy learning beyond my normal scope of topics.
Yes! Great first semester intro class
I would recommend it to another student because it is a good beginning course for MMPP students.
Oh yeah. It was generally a positive experience
I would recommend the class upon assurance of better organization of the course.
Yes, but maybe once it's been more developed.
